Of all the christmases that we've had if there was 
ever a time that we deserved a nice little drink,

it's probably this christmas right, and I want 
to show you a brilliant way of taking your

everyday vodka and infusing it with the flavors 
of christmas, and this is fantastic for christmas

and beyond and it's so easy. So look here 
I've got things like cloves here standard

like that kind of mulled wine vibe. We've got 
cinnamon sticks, we've got things like the red

peppercorns, you could use black peppercorns.
You know herbs like rosemary or bay even a

little sliver of chilli makes the most incredible 
difference and then citrus. Clementine, lemon, lime.

Any mixture or combination of these the zest 
or the peel actually is what you want. So I've

got a pan here, I'll put it on a medium-high heat 
and we're gonna toast these spices. So the stick

goes in, let's get the flavours waking up right. 
Let's toast those spices. I'll take three or four

cloves, not many, be subtle. We're gonna put the red 
peppercorns in there. I'm gonna take a little half

of chilli through the stalk there, like that. I 
will remove the seeds because that's too hot

right. We want it to be very subtle just a nice 
little hum of heat and we're going to take that

chiLli and just pop that in too. Then we're going 
to use a peeler and take little bits of lime peel,

and two or three will be more than enough. The same 
with clementine, get that peel in there. Then a few

peels of lemon. Give that a little shake, as the pan 
heats up you can hear it scolding and heating up

all the natural oils in the peel and the spices. 
We'll take a little bit of herb as well, rosemary

and that is going to be lovely. That smells 
amazing. So take this off the heat and then just

carefully pick up your toasted herbs, spices, the 
cinnamon goes in. That little bit of chilli goes in.

All those amazing bits of orange and lemon zest, 
honestly that little bit of heat makes such a

difference and immediately it will change the 
flavour of the vodka. Let's take those peppercorns

get them in as well. So put the lid on and 
then give it a little shake, move it around

and look it's a beautiful thing, it looks nice, 
a nice little label, a little bow. That makes a

beautiful little present for someone you love 
and after three days that gets really good and

then beyond it keeps changing and evolving. So the 
question is what to do with a beautiful, infused
vodka? I've got one that I've made before and I'm gonna make you a beautiful christmas cosmopolitan.

It's a brilliant cocktail and in the last sort 
of five or six years I've enjoyed making myself a

civilised, grown-up cocktail just to kind 
of set things off nice. I think we deserve

a little cocktail this year. So get some ice 
in whatever kind of beaker or cup you want

and then we're going to get one of these of course. 
You can use like a little jug or something like

that, you don't have to be uptight about how 
you do it. I'm going to take some ice, put that

into your receptacle. I'm going to use 
40 millilitres of your infused vodka.

So in that goes, this is last year's one. So that 
will be tasting absolutely fantastic. Then we're

going to go in with 10 mls of triple sec. So 
that goes straight in as well. Now traditionally

for a cosmopolitan you'd use cranberry 
juice and I love that but as it's christmas,

come on let's go pomegranate, I love it. 
I love pomegranate, it's such a beautiful,

beautiful thing and look at that, fantastic. So 
either or, cranberries, christmassy. Pomegranates

are christmassy. What I love to do and the flavour 
from this is amazing and so much better than

any juice you'll get out of a carton is just 
grab it with your hands, get this and squeeze

about 25 mils of your pomegranate juice into there. 
So what I'm going to do now is put this on top,

give it a spank, shake it. It doesn't 
matter if you haven't got one of these,

you can just stir it. You can use your sieve 
or any small little sieve. Get your glass which

you've got cold which I love. Goes nice and 
frosty and then you can pour your beautiful

christmas cosmopolitan into your 
glass, come on. Right, let's have a try...

Christmas in the glass, come 
on! Christmas cosmopolitan
for yourself or someone you love, cheers.
